comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Carl Gottlieb Bünz (* Juli 25, 1843 in Marne (Holstein); † September 15, 1918 in Atlanta) was a German diplomat. From 1914 to 1915 he was the general manager of the Hamburg - American Line in New York. In this role he was responsible for the supply of German cruisers in the Atlantic by neutral ships with coal and provisions. In December 1915 he was therefore tried and sentenced to 18 months in prison for "conspiracy to defraud the United States." The judgment became final after dismissal of the appeal. Bünz began his sentence on 23 April 1918 in the state prison in Atlanta , where he fell ill and died in September 1918, at the day he was reprieved by President Wilson. de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Gottlieb_B%C3%BCnz see also The sun., January 11, 1918, Page 2

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks B-59. He came up one other time in Bain. In newspapers of the time his name was spelled both Karl and Carl, and Bunz and Buenz. I found one case where he himself seems to have used Buenz. I'll ask that we add the various spellings to our catalog record.
